habitats: Underwater palaces in oceans, lakes, and rivers made of crystal, coral, and jewels
Springs, wells, and sacred bathing pools
The roots of great trees near water
abilities: Weather Control: Summon rain, cause drought, create storms or calm waters
Shape-shifting: Transform between serpent, semi-human, and human forms at will
Treasure Guardianship: Possess and protect vast hoards of jewels, gold, and sacred objects
Venom: Deadly poison breath or bite that can kill instantly or cause disease
Longevity: Live for thousands of years, witnessing ages pass
Size Alteration: Shrink to human size or expand to mountain-filling proportions
name: Serpent Deities of Buddhist Mythology
physicalDescription: Serpent Deities, Guardians of Waters and Wisdom Nagas are shape-shifters who can appear in multiple forms:
habitat: Underwater palaces in oceans, lakes, and rivers made of crystal, coral, and jewels, Springs, wells, and sacred bathing pools, The roots of great trees near water, Caves behind waterfalls, Beneath earth at water sources
appearance: Serpent Deities, Guardians of Waters and Wisdom Nagas are shape-shifters who can appear in multiple forms:
